divs: Sighting DetailsMy wife and I were outside in the backyard enjoying our firepit when I noticed a bright light traveling from the mountains to the east. I thought it was an airplane preparing an approach for landing at DIA, but, the light got brighter and did not have any colored lights on the bottom. I pointed it out to my wife and as we watched, the bright light changed directions and went north, rather quicklyly. As it went north the light dimmed quickly to a small glow and the size of the light shrank to the size of the visible stars and then poof, it was gone. Total length of sighting was maybe 1 minute 30 seconds. We live in Arvada, CO and are used to seeing lots of plains as they approach DIA occassionly from the west. I thought it was a plane at first, but it was too bright and the light too big and it changed directions way to fast, ewat then north. Then I thought it was a satelite but they don't change directions on a tight line????? Was cool seeing something that makes no sense. BTW, I am reporting this 25 minutes after seeing it.

Summary: Sitting by firepit, bright object traveling east then changed direction and went north. Was very bright then dimmed and vanished. Not a plane and not a satelite. familiar with both, in DIA landing approach lain in Arvada, CO
